intro: Gentianodes tongolensis, commonly known as the Tongol gentian, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blue or violet flowers. The plant is characterized by its striking blue petals and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
